text_eng: You try to turn the knob.
It initially seems stuck. However, with enough force, you are able to start turning it. The doorknob resists, and you push harder.
Just as the door is about to open, the handle furiously snaps back.
The motion is distinctly organic, like a snake wrestling its way out of your grasp.
No attempt or motion toward entry. No noise. The knob is merely held in place.
